intro: Androsace paxiana, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Androsace paxiana thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
